entry.title: Sertac Karaman named director of the Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems
entry.summary: Associate professor of aeronautics and astronautics will head MIT’s longest continuously-running lab.

entry.title: The tenured engineers of 2021
entry.summary: Eight faculty members have been granted tenure in five departments across the MIT School of Engineering.

entry.title: US Air Force pilots get an artificial intelligence assist with scheduling aircrews
entry.summary: An optimization tool from the Department of Air Force–MIT AI Accelerator is transforming the laborious process of staffing C-17 cargo flights.

entry.title: Infrared cameras and artificial intelligence provide insight into boiling
entry.summary: MIT researchers train a neural network to predict a “boiling crisis,” with potential applications for cooling computer chips and nuclear reactors.

author.name: Matthew Hutson | Department of Nuclear Science and Engineering

entry.title: Designing exploratory robots that collect data for marine scientists
entry.summary: “This is a really exciting time to be a roboticist who also cares about the environment,” says PhD student Victoria Preston.

entry.title: Designing exploratory robots that collect data for marine scientists
entry.summary: “This is a really exciting time to be a roboticist who also cares about the environment,” says PhD student Victoria Preston.

entry.title: Giving robots better moves
entry.summary: MIT alumnus-founded RightHand Robotics has developed picking robots that are more reliable and adaptable in warehouse environments.

entry.title: The power of two
entry.summary: Graduate student Ellen Zhong helped biologists and mathematicians reach across departmental lines to address a longstanding problem in electron microscopy.

entry.title: MIT and U.S. Department of Defense team up to launch a new edX learning platform
entry.summary: MIT offers first courses on the platform, which aims to serve cutting-edge manufacturing education to more Americans.

author.name: Julie Diop | Department of Materials Science and Engineering

entry.title: Intelligent carpet gives insight into human poses
entry.summary: Tactical sensing carpet estimates 3D human poses without the use of cameras, and could improve health monitoring and smart homes.

entry.title: Four MIT faculty members receive 2021 US Department of Energy early career awards
entry.summary: Faculty from the departments of Physics and of Nuclear Science and Engineering faculty were selected for the Early Career Research Program.

author.name: Alison Gold | School of Engineering | School of Science

entry.title: Tackling air pollution with autonomous drones
entry.summary: Alumni of the MIT New Engineering Education Transformation Program (NEET) worked together remotely from across the globe to design thinking machines.

entry.title: Tackling air pollution with autonomous drones
entry.summary: Alumni of the MIT New Engineering Education Transformation Program (NEET) worked together remotely from across the globe to design thinking machines.

entry.title: Four researchers earn interdisciplinary Schmidt Science Fellowships
entry.summary: Selective global honor supports early-career scientists and engineers in taking on new pursuits.

author.name: David Orenstein | Picower Institute for Learning and Memory

entry.title: v1.11.0
entry.summary:
Added: support an experimental template for YouTube feed 📺 Demo | Source
Aggregate content from any YouTube channel rss url https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=<replace_with_channel_id> Videos are embedded via iframe and loading accelerated by youtube-lite-embed Ads are reduced thanks to YouTube's policy for embedded videos 🙃 Works on mobile devices with butter smooth horizontal scroll. Caveat: the template works only with YouTube content. You cannot mix textual RSS feed or other video sources such as Vimeo. Changed: Default HTML template meta tag adjusted to match convention Changed: sources in template data is now ordered by last update timestamp (as opposed to alphabetical) Thank you @PiyushLosalka

entry.title: Developing drones to address pandemic-related challenges in Scandinavia
entry.summary: After meeting in an Advanced Study Program at MIT, three Norwegian students began working together to transport biological samples using autonomous vehicles.

entry.title: A unique collaboration with US Special Operations Command
entry.summary: Nearly 300 government and military members participated in a new course designed to explore the next generation of artificial intelligence and related technologies.

author.name: Kate S. Petersen | School of Engineering

entry.title: Uncovering the mysteries of milk
entry.summary: PhD student Sarah Nyquist applies computational methods to understudied areas of reproductive health, such as the cellular composition of breast milk.

entry.title: The new wave of robotic automation
entry.summary: Peter Howard SM ’84 is the CEO of Realtime Robotics, a startup transforming autonomous robot motion planning to enable seamless, affordable human-robot collaboration.

author.name: Daniel de Wolff | MIT Startup Exchange

entry.title: Unlocking the potential of blockchain technology
entry.summary: Algorand uses a unique architecture developed by MIT Professor Silvio Micali to offer a decentralized, secure, and scalable blockchain.

entry.title: Creating “digital twins” at scale
entry.summary: Model could help predictive virtual models become standard practice in engineering.
